3 N k | $ P À P | S edited by N A

Dykescapes brings together stories from
many corners of today’s lesbian landscape,
as seventeen new and established
storytellers explore such diverse themes as
racism, death, lesbian parenting, prison
relationships, and interracial love and sex.
And they don’t flinch from controversy:
their stories also deal with role-playing,
fat-positivity, and intergenerational affairs.
Trade paper, $8.95, 176 pages.
ISBN 1-55583-195-8
Certain Voices:
Short Stories about Gay Men
edited by Darryl Pilcher
Certain Voices mirrors the diversity
of the gay male experience, exploring
contemporary issues from a variety of
perspectives. Editor Darryl Pilcher has
gathered here black, Latino, and Caucasian
voices, among them many new writers.
From the Provincetown ferry to the Middle
East, Certain Voices reveals the intimate
workings of today’s gay male world.
Trade paper, $8.95, 224 pages.
ISBN 1-55583-194-X
